instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 no image
threads.message:
Hello,

I got this 820-3332 with green light OK, chime OK, no image. I know it has booted into the OS as I can hear the volume up/down adjustment sound. When I close the lid for some minutes and open it up again, I get an image and everything works fine! What do I check? The plastic cover on U1800 looks heated up. No history. No liquid damage visible.

threads.title: 820-3332 no image
threads.message: Did you touch up the solder joints on U8900 yet?

threads.title: 820-3332 no image
threads.message: That was the first thing I did, no luck...

threads.title: 820-3332 no image
threads.message: Known good LCD? LCD_HPD line can cause issues like this, check diode mode and connector/cable.
